thread.title: Circus elephants stop for brunch in the North End - News
thread.title_full: Circus elephants stop for brunch in the North End - News

author: boston.com
title: Circus elephants stop for brunch in the North End - News
text:
Elephants from Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus stopped for their annual lunch on Hanover Street Wednesday.
The circus announced earlier this year they would be retiring its elephants by 2018.
A look back at Ringling Bros. elephants in Boston over the years:
 Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey elephants visited Hanover Street in the North End for their annual brunch and playtime. David L. Ryan / Boston Globe For brunch they ate veggies and watermelon. David L. Ryan / Boston Globe David L. Ryan / Boston Globe David L. Ryan / Boston Globe David L. Ryan / Boston Globe Spectators took photos on Hanover Street. David L. Ryan / Boston Globe The elephants were escorted by police and a crew, who left the area clean. David L. Ryan / Boston Globe In 2014, the elephants had a selection of apples, carrots, bannanas, and watermelon for brunch. Jonathan Wiggs / Boston Globe In 2013, police officers and others rolled watermelons, a favorite dessert, to the elephants. David L. Ryan/Globe Staff Elephants walk along the Charles on their way through Cambridge to the local production of Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus in 2011. Josh Reynolds / Boston Globe Nine elephants make their way along Memorial Drive en route to the TD Garden in 2010. Yoon S. Byun / Boston Globe In 2008, the circus pulled into town late and the elephants made their walk from the train in Cambridge toward the TD Banknorth Garden. Justine Hunt The elephants made the walk along Memorial Drive in 2006. David L. Ryan / Boston Globe In 2005, the elephants took their annual walk from Cambridge to the TD Garden. Pat Greenhouse / Boston Globe The elephants walked along McGrath Highway in 1999. George Rizer / Boton Globe The elephants had a salad break in 1999. David L. Ryan / Boston Globe The elephants got a pizza party at Fanueil Hall in 1998. RYAN, DAVID L. GLOBE STAFF PHOTO The elephants got their brunch while visiting Quincy Market in 1997. Barry Chin / Boston Globe In 1991, elephants paraded on Hanover Street, headed to their 'pasta party.'
